Adam Koper examines the role of human enhancement in the Deus Ex series

Remembering Leonard Nimoy

With the tragic loss of Leonard Nimoy, Katy Sandalls looks back on the life of a sci-fi legend

Review: Abigail's Party

Drama Soc's performance of Abigail's Party is certainly a hit, combining the feel of the gaudy 70's with some unique and entertaining characters. Ashley Reed reviews.

Review: Cara Josephine

Holly Woolnough reviews Josie Long's new show, Cara Josephine, at the Duchess. Promising hilarity and heartbreak, Long certainly lived up to expectations.

TV Review: Wolf Hall Series 1 Episode 6: 'Master of Phantoms'

Wolf Hall's final episode shows how it has excelled at bringing complex historical characters to life, says Laura Flannigan

"In the battle between heart and mind, mind came out on top"

Despite the Boyhood snub, last Sunday's Oscars rewarded an outstanding year in film, says Tom Parkes

Live Review: Peace @ Brudenell Social Club, Leeds

Their fan base is fervent and they know their way around a tight, catchy, pop song

TV Review: The Walking Dead Series 5 Episode 11: 'The Distance'

The group have to decide who to trust in this week's The Walking Dead. Liam Dooley reviews.

Sugar, Spice and Not Everything's Nice

19 year-old photography student, Hannah Altman, releases a photographic series criticising the unrealistic portrayals of women in the media. Lara Shannon considers the significance of Altman's work and its instant popularity online.

Album Review: BADBADNOTGOOD & Ghostface Killah - Sour Soul

A left field collaboration is pulled off with experimental flair, says Aaron Stennett

Review: Antony and Cleopatra

In aid of York Theatre Royal's re-development project, actors both local and renowned stage a rehearsed reading of Shakespeare's Antony and Cleopatra. Daniel Bowen reviews.

London Fashion Week: Day Five Summary

All the action from the fifth and final day

York: a UNESCO City of Media Arts

As York wins the accolade of a UNESCO City of Media Arts, Angelica Curzi considers what the title really means and what's in store for the city over the coming year.

Live Review: Luxo Jr and Frontier Ruckus @ The Basement, York

The newly re-vamped venue plays host to a night of deft musicianship and eclectic styles

Fifty shades falls flat

University of York FetSoc members discuss why real-life BDSM practitioners are dismayed at Fifty Shades of Grey.

Review: Blackhat

Michael Mann's cybercrime thriller is a waste of a brilliant concept, says Tom Parkes

TV Review: Wolf Hall Series 1 Episode 5: 'Crows'

Anne and Cromwell's positions are increasingly vulnerable as Wolf Hall enters its penultimate episode. Laura Flannigan reviews

Festivals 2015: Leeds Festival announces third headliner, over 50 more acts

The Libertines will headline the festival in August
